thread.title: This Video Explains How GitHub Works As Simply As Possible
thread.title_full: This Video Explains How GitHub Works As Simply As Possible

author: Thorin Klosowski
title: This Video Explains How GitHub Works As Simply As Possible
text:
Go to permalink 
As ubiquitous as it is, GitHub is a little baffling for beginners because it’s not evident at the start how it actually works. So, GitHub made a video to help make sense of it all. How the Heck Do I Use GitHub? How the Heck Do I Use GitHub? How the Heck Do I Use GitHub? Dear Lifehacker, I've learned to code and want to start using GitHub to manage my projects.… Read more Read more 
The video is essentially a beginner’s guide to GitHub’s terminology, how it works, why you’d use it, and more. It walks you through how pull requests work, when you’d fork a project, and more. It’s a straightforward introduction that doesn’t provide much more than a few vocabulary words, but it’s still useful for anyone new to GitHub. Advertisement
